[bq="QuasarNova"]And above that, aliens that use our Universe and many others like marbles[/bq]
Here's a dumb question; could god/s technically count as aliens because when you think about it if we're talking about the religions where their holy text say their god/s created the earth and/or universe that would mean they weren't born on earth.  Like I know there isn't actually a religion around Cthulu, but it's the best analogy for what I mean in the Cthulu both counts as a god and a alien.
"Marvin what do you make of all this?"
"Well you got to have a opinion.  Do you actually think that God came down from heaven and stopped" *POW*

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/543ee919636872253a290100#post_543ee919636872253a290100

No such thing as a dumb question, only dumb answers from me.

Really. Gods are meant as a simple explanation created by men to better understand the world around them and it helps copping with the fact that yes, we are a simple speck of dust and like you explained, the chances of meeting other species is almost none and some can't deal with the fact that we're alone in  a grand scale, and knowing that might be something up there caring for one is uplifting (personal views aside).

My personal belief is that Gods represent beings that have gone far into the evolution line and have gotten to a point we can't really comprehend.

Not necessarily aliens, but among their own species.

"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/543eea2e6368723640770200#post_543eea2e6368723640770200

"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/543eea6c6368725f1f4e0200#post_543eea6c6368725f1f4e0200
Personally I have a really weird view when it comes to religion.  Like personally I think there are god/s, but not in the way we think they are nor do they serve a purpose we think they do.  To use a analogy I think they're more along the lines of "one above all" from Marvel; not really a "god" or there to play baby sitter or to create life or anything traditionally associated with god/s so much as there to make sure no one tries to destroy the universes and make sure no one destroys all of reality.  They'll never step in to stop you from doing something, but the second you try to destroy all the universes you're fucked.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/543eec7a63687239637e0100#post_543eec7a63687239637e0100

That comes more into the "What they do" rather than the "What they are" territory.

It's like when you get a job, you have your desk, and the job that comes with it.

Then you get a prrrrrrrrrrrromotion and you're moved into another area, where you deal with other stuff, sometimes more important, and so forth.

A God is a creator first and foremost, but after creating that life, they move into another cycle or leave another God to micro manage the rest.
